trans-unit.source: Defines an area within which you can explicitly position child elements by using coordinates that are relative to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref> area.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> contains a collection of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects, which are in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.Children%2A> property.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> is the only panel element that has no inherent layout characteristics.

A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> has default <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> properties of zero, unless it is the child of an element that automatically sizes its child elements.
Child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> are never resized, they are just positioned at their designated coordinates.
This provides flexibility for situations in which inherent sizing constraints or alignment are not needed or wanted.
For cases in which you want child content to be automatically resized and aligned, it is usually best to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid> element.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.ZIndex%2A> property determines the order in which child elements that share the same coordinate space appear.
A higher <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.ZIndex%2A> value for one child element indicates that this element will appear above another child element that has a lower value.

If you specify them, the attached properties <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left%2A?displayProperty=fullName> take priority over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties.
Child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> are always given the full size that they desire.
As a result, vertical alignment and horizontal alignment have no effect inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas> is a top-level layout control that you can use for absolute positioning of child content.
For painting and drawing, you use brushes and do not have to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas>.
For more information, see [Painting with Solid Colors and Gradients Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/painting-with-solid-colors-and-gradients-overview.md).
By default, panel elements do not receive focus.
To compel a panel element to receive focus, set the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A> property to `true`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref> class.
Arranges the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref> element.
The size that this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref> element should use to arrange its child elements.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the arranged size of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref> element and its descendants.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom"></xref> attached property.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element from which the property value is read.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Returns a clipping geometry that indicates the area that will be clipped if the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.ClipToBounds"></xref> property is set to `true`.
The available size of the element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> that represents the area that is clipped if <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.ClipToBounds"></xref> is `true`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element from which the property value is read.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element from which the property value is read.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element from which the property value is read.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left"></xref> attached property.

Measures the child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas"></xref> in anticipation of arranging them during the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)"></xref> pass.
An upper limit <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that should not be exceeded.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the size that is required to arrange child content.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right"></xref> attached property.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element to which the property value is written.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Bottom"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element to which the property value is written.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Left"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element to which the property value is written.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Right"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element to which the property value is written.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top"></xref> coordinate of the specified element.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Canvas.Top"></xref> attached property.
